title: ask returns 404 for gpt-4o-mini on puck.local
description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) BAISH_OPENAI_BASE_URL=puck.local, BAISH_MODEL=gpt-4o-mini.
2) Run: ask 'What time is it'

Observed:
- ask repeatedly tries both puck.local:80/v1/chat/completions and :8000 then fails with HTTP 404 "The model `gpt-4o-mini` does not exist."
- Subsequent /models call also repeats the connection attempts and lists only two models:
  - nvidia/NVIDIA-Nemotron-3-Nano-30B-A3B-FP8
  - modelperm-8785c1c323a23a80
- The default suggested model gpt-4o-mini is missing/unavailable on the puck endpoint, leaving ask unusable with the documented defaults.

Sample output:
```
jkh@plubbit-> ask 'What time is it'

baish: models reported by the API (2):
  nvidia/NVIDIA-Nemotron-3-Nano-30B-A3B-FP8
  modelperm-8785c1c323a23a80
```

Expected:
- ask should succeed with a working default model or provide clear configuration guidance without repeated connection spam.

comments.author: Jordan Hubbard
comments.text: Expected interactive behavior: after the user runs ask, print a single line like "Asking <hostname>:<modelname> <question text>" before making requests. Then either (a) print the answer, or (b) if connections to the host fail, say so plainly, or (c) if the model is unavailable, say so and list the models the endpoint reports. In either failure case, also tell the user which environment variables to set to fix it (e.g., BAISH_OPENAI_BASE_URL, BAISH_MODEL, OPENAI_API_KEY, BAISH_OPENAI_PORT/FAIL_FAST/AUTOEXEC as applicable).
